translation: "If worldly desires and pleasures or pleasures arising from craving are not equal to one internal pleasure, then one of the sixteen is the greatest, the bliss of meditation, the first, the white dharma, freedom from birth and death, the first pleasure of ending craving, the ultimate nonretrogression, the lack of fear and knowledge, and those who cultivate it and do not seek it. Thus, the bliss of meditation has no comparison. If someone is not bound by craving and doubts what they do not harbor, then they will cross the ocean of existence and always experience all pleasures.
